title: Belt-Tightening Could Mean Fewer Hubble and Chandra Observations
summary: NASA is bracing for a period of budgetary belt-tightening as House Republicans demand deep cuts to nondefense discretionary spending, the category that includes NASA. The effects will be felt across […]

title: SwRI wins QuickSounder weather satellite contract
summary: The Southwest Research Institute won a $55 million contract to supply the QuickSounder weather satellite.

title: Launch Roundup: SpaceX surpass 5,000 active Starlink satellites; China to send taikonauts to space station
summary: The week of Oct. 23 through Oct 30 is a big one for low-Earth orbit (LEO) with all but one flight headed to already existing constellations. This includes two Falcon 9 launches on opposite sides of the country and two different launches planned out of China, one involving humans.

title: Space Force identifying priorities for modernizing spaceports
summary: With $1.3 billion in projected funding for spaceport improvements, the Space Force is now trying to move these plans forward, identifying the most critical areas needing attention in the near-term.

title: China adds Belarus as partner for ILRS moon base
summary: Belarus joined China's International Lunar Research Station program Monday, following a video conference with the China National Space Administration.
